cxs.cxl: past tense and past participle of

dt: {bc}to contend in battle or physical combat
{bc}to strive to overcome a person by blows or weapons

dt.t: He will {wi}fight{/wi} for the heavyweight title next month.

dt: {bc}to contend against in or as if in battle or physical combat
{bc}to attempt to prevent the success or effectiveness of
{bc}to oppose the passage or development of
{bc}to take part in (a boxing match or similar contest)
{bc}to manage (a ship) in a battle or storm
{bc}to manage in an unnecessarily rough or awkward manner

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}feohtan{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}fehtan{/it} to fight and perhaps to Latin {it}pectere{/it} to comb {ma}{mat|pectinate|}{/ma}
shortdef: to contend in battle or physical combat; especially : to strive to overcome a person by blows or weapons
to put forth a determined effort

dt: {bc}requiring a lot of effort or hard work

dt.t: He won a {it}hard-fought{/it} campaign for reelection.

dt: {bc}achieved or acquired through a lot of effort or hard work

shortdef: requiring a lot of effort or hard work
achieved or acquired through a lot of effort or hard work

dt: {bc}to attack or try to defeat someone who is attacking or trying to defeat oneself

dt.t: We can't just let them make these accusations against us. We need to {it}fight back{/it}!

dt: {bc}to make a new effort against an opponent

dt.t: They fell behind early in the game, but they were able to {it}fight back{/it} and tie the score in the second half.

shortdef: to attack or try to defeat someone who is attacking or trying to defeat oneself
to make a new effort against an opponent

dt.t: This is a cause that's worth {it}fighting for{/it}.

dt: {bc}to fight or struggle to get, keep, or achieve (something)

dt.t: The team is {it}fighting for{/it} a spot in the play-offs.
The two armies {it}fought{/it} all night {it}for{/it} control of the fort.

shortdef: to fight or struggle to get, keep, or achieve (something)

dt: {bc}to defend oneself against (someone or something) by fighting or struggling {bc}to avoid being harmed or overcome by (someone or something) by fighting or struggling

dt.t: I'm trying to {it}fight off{/it} a cold.

shortdef: to defend oneself against (someone or something) by fighting or struggling : to avoid being harmed or overcome by (someone or something) by fighting or struggling

dt.t: He vowed that he would {it}fight on{/it} alone.
He {it}fought with{/it} his wife over/about money.
The U.S. {it}fought with{/it} Germany in World Wars I and II.

dt: {bc}to fight on the same side as (someone or something)

dt.t: The U.S. {it}fought{/it} (together) {it}with{/it} the Soviet Union in World War II.

dt: {bc}to fight by using (something, such as a weapon)

shortdef: to fight on the same side as (someone or something)
to fight by using (something, such as a weapon)
